text: Jan Carlos Granado (born September 26, 1982 in Caracas, Venezuela) is a Venezuelan former professional baseball pitcher. ==Career== Granado signed as an undrafted free agent with the Cincinnati Reds in 1999. He was selected by the Minnesota Twins in the minor league section of the 2004 Rule 5 draft. Granado represented Venezuela national baseball team in the 2009 World Baseball Classic. ==External links== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Águilas del Zulia players Category:Anderson Joes players Category:Bravos de Margarita players Category:Chattanooga Lookouts players Category:Dayton Dragons players Category:Diablos Rojos del México players Category:Fort Myers Miracle players Category:Guerreros de Oaxaca players Category:Gulf Coast Reds players Category:Mexican League baseball pitchers Category:Grosseto Baseball Club players Category:Navegantes del Magallanes players Category:New Britain Rock Cats players Category:Newark Bears players Category:Potomac Cannons players Category:Sarasota Reds players Category:Sportspeople from Caracas Category:Tigres de Aragua players Category:Vaqueros Laguna players Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in Italy Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in Mexico Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in the United States Category:World Baseball Classic players of Venezuela Category:2009 World Baseball Classic players
title: Jan Granado
